snippet: Nine sites that would have served 265 students will not open because of safety concerns or other issues, officials announced two days before the first day of school.
abstract: Nine private programs set to offer free, New York City-funded prekindergarten will not open due to safety and other issues; 36 other programs will also not be ready for first day of school; extending free kindergarten to all 4-year-olds was Mayor Bill de Blasio's signature campaign proposal and much is riding on its success; still, the 45 programs cited represent small portion of some 1,100 private sites that are scheduled to open.
lead_paragraph: Nine sites that would have served 265 students will not open because of safety concerns or other issues, officials announced two days before the first day of school.

headline.main: New York Cancels or Postpones Opening of 45 Pre-K Programs
headline.print_headline: City Cancels or Postpones Opening of 45 Pre-K Programs
